oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Music History program - various voice overs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Various voice overs by an unidentified male narrator. Subject matter pertains to the history of country music, and recording is likely linked to a country music history radio program, exhibit, or documentary.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:02) [Unidentified] talks about country music's roots originating from England, Ireland, and Scotland -- (00:20) [Unidentified] talks about country music adapting to a hostile world, in war and revolution -- (00:40)) [Unidentified] talks about mail order catalogues and musical instruments -- (00:54) [Unidentified] talks about performers in traveling shows -- (01:15) [Unidentified] talks about disc recordings, and the subject matter of country music -- (02:03) [Unidentified] talks about country music's popularity in modern culture, and the influence of Bill Monroe, Roy Acuff, and Bob Wills -- (02:27) [Unidentified] talks about the comedians of country music, as well as cowboy clothing -- (02:54) [Unidentified] talks about the stars of country music -- (03:11) [Unidentified] talks about country music evolving over time, but staying connected to its rural roots -- (03:32) [Unidentified] talks about the values of country music, and how it has transformed from rural Britain to a native American art form
